q: Why should barriers be resealed after a storm event?
a: Stormwater carries silt and salts that degrade sealant bonds. Resealing restores watertight integrity and prevents micro-leakage on next deployment.

q: How do you reseal a flood barrier?
a: Clean joints with solvent, remove debris, dry 24 hrs, then apply marine polyurethane. Cure ≥ 48 hrs before reinstalling panels. See flood-panel repair.

q: How soon after resealing can I reinstall panels?
a: After 48 hrs cure at 70 °F. Faster only with moisture-cure sealants rated for submerged service.
